resources.string: Scan your aadhaar card to view information
There Is no Saved Aadhar Card

Our aim is to help these children educate themselves by providing classes in their vicinity and engaging them in not just books but in arts and cultural activities for their holistic development as individuals.
Providing free education for underprivileged children near Pragati Maidan at Janta Camp, Bhairon Marg, New Delhi, India

Sabki Pathshala is a voluntary initiative started by Ms. Neetu Singh, who having struggled to study under extreme financial and social difficulties herself, empathises with children facing similar challenges. Circumstances of these children force them to deviate from the path of education and find ways of earning quick money by doing odd jobs, begging and even crime. But at Sabki Pathshala, the aim is to help these children educate themselves by providing classes in their vicinity and engaging them in not just books but in arts and cultural activities for their holistic development as individuals. Years of efforts put in by Ms. Neetu Singh have finally started bearing fruit and she has also been awarded by platforms such as The Rotary Club, Delhi Commission of Women etc and media coverage, for her efforts. Support this movement for a new generation of bright minds who need us to break free from their circumstances. Contact us for more information on how you can support.
